page.title: 03 HUGH SEXEY OF BRUTON.
page.content: Hugh Sexey was born in the middle of the sixteenth century.He was the son of poor parents.We do not know for certain where he was born,although the surname Sexey appears on the parish register.He was a clever man and,like many others,became wealthy during the Reformation,acquiring considerable property.In 1599 he was made a governor of the Free Grammar School of Bruton. He built a house in Bruton,"on the west side of the town near Wynne's well."It has been suggested that he lived in the mill at West End,but in 1795 this was called Swanton's House. In fact he preferred living in his other house in Wedmore.In his will,he left money for the poor of Bruton.This built Sexey's Hospital.Later some money went to Sexey's School.
